title: Attempts to mislead people: B'desh leader Yunus on coup rumours
description: Bangladesh's interim government leader Muhammad Yunus dismissed rumours that a coup is being plotted against him by the military, calling the claims "attempts to mislead people". "In order to destabilise the country, some people are spreading rumours," Yunus said.

title: Oscar-winning Palestinian director injured in Israeli attack released
description: Hamdan Ballal, the Palestinian co-director of Oscar-winning film 'No Other Land', has been released from Israeli detention after being attacked by Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank. Ballal was injured in the attack and later arrested.

title: Expat flies to India as UK's NHS delays surgery, calls Indian hospitals 'blessing in disguise'
description: A man, who suffered a severe hand injury, claimed he flew to India because he was "frustrated" after UK's NHS delayed his surgery. He also called Indian hospitals a "blessing in disguise". His post sparked a debate about healthcare systems.

title: 3 Teams That Fought for Ashutosh Sharma in IPL 2025 Mega Auctions
description: Ashutosh Sharma's IPL Stardom. After a breathtaking finish against LSG, where he dramatically accelerated from 20 off 20 to seal DC's victory, Ashutosh Sharma has solidified his position as one of the most exciting young talents in IPL.

title: Freedom can't be used for personal attacks: Yogi on Kamra row
description: Reacting to comedian Kunal Kamra's remarks on Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said freedom of expression cannot be used for personal attacks. "Unfortunately, some people, to gain popularity, make personal attacks," he said.

title: India's highway network will be better than US in 2 yrs: Gadkari
description: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday claimed that the road highway network in India will be better than US within two years. "I do not think there is any problem in the road sector," he said.

title: IIT Kanpur unveils 31st edition of its 'Techkriti' fest from March 27-30
description: IIT Kanpur introduces Techkriti 31.0 from March 27-30, which features an array of competitions, workshops, and challenges in AI, robotics, coding, and business. Highlights include Rakshakriti - The Defence Challenge and Startup Expo.

title: Delhi plans smart monitoring hub to tackle pollution
description: The Delhi government has proposed an Integrated Command and Control Centre in its 2025-26 Budget to enable real-time tracking of air quality, water pollution, noise levels, and waste management. Presenting the budget, Finance Minister Kailash Gahlot said the centre will integrate data from various monitoring stations.

title: Anushka Sen tries Korean Gochujang Dosa for the first time
description: Anushka Sen tried the Korean Gochujang Dosa for the first time in Kandivali. This unique dish is smothered with cheese and gochujang, making a thin, crispy sheet of savoury perfection. It is also topped with fresh vegetables and herbs.

title: Secretive Chinese tech firm trying to recruit recently laid-off US govt workers: Report
description: A secretive Chinese technology firm has been trying to recruit recently laid-off US government workers, Reuters reported citing a researcher who uncovered the campaign. The firm "seeks to exploit the knowledge and access of former US government employees," the report said.
